supporting_text: The NAP includes specific goals for human health, such as reducing antibiotic use in the total inhabitants by 30 percent.
The NAP outlines goals for food-producing animals, including reducing antibiotic use in terrestrial animals by at least 10 percent.
The NAP includes goals for mapping antibiotic resistant bacteria in representative environments and studying the effects of other drivers of resistance.
The NAP includes specific actions related to antibiotic use in food-producing animals and household pets.
The NAP states that the interdepartmental working group will follow up implementation and review the status at mid-point and towards the end of the strategy period.
The NAP sets specific targets, such as reducing antibiotic prescriptions for respiratory infections by 20 percent compared to 2012.
The document states that the description of measures is limited to those that can be implemented within applicable budget frameworks.
The NAP mentions the continuation of an interdepartmental working group to follow up on the implementation of the strategy.
The NAP emphasizes the need for improved understanding and competence regarding the use of antibiotics among prescribers and the general population.
The NAP includes plans for mass media campaigns to educate the public about antibiotic resistance.
The NAP states the importance of international cooperation and mentions working with WHO, FAO, and OIE.
The NAP outlines the need for mapping antibiotic resistant bacteria and improving monitoring systems.
The NAP emphasizes the need for improved monitoring and analysis of incidences of resistant bacteria.
The NAP includes improved infection control measures as a focus area.
The document does not specifically mention adherence to OIE or FAO/WHO standards.
The NAP discusses the need for improved prescribing practices and monitoring of antibiotic prescriptions.
The NAP mentions the need for updated therapeutic recommendations and norms to maintain good prescribing practices.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of responsible use of antibiotics and adherence to technical guidelines.
The NAP states that Norway will participate actively in international research collaborations for new antibiotics and diagnostic methods.
